fact_text: The National Weather Service has issued an "extreme red flag" warning for the area. Much of Los Angeles and Ventura counties remain under a National Weather Service red flag warning of extreme fire danger through Thursday evening. With gusts stronger than 50 mph expected in some areas, more than 17 million people in the California's southern half are under red flag warnings -- meaning wind, humidity and other conditions are ripe for fires.

Cal Fire spokesman Jonathan Cox says the nearly 77 thousand plus acre Kincade Fire is now 45 percent contained, and hasn't seen much growth since the last update. The #kincadefire is at 60% containment, the power is on, evacuation orders have been lifted, and wine country communities are returning to their homes and businesses.

The Kincade fire burned into history Wednesday, becoming Sonoma County’s largest wildfire by scorching an area three times the size of Santa Rosa as a force of more than 5,000 firefighters gained a grip on the week-old conflagration.

Firefighters made good progress against the massive wildfire in Sonoma County overnight. Firefighters are working to defend the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library against the flames.

Dear neighbors, The Kincade Fire has burned scores of structures and many more are threatened, and over 90,000 people have been displaced. The wildfire outside LA that led to the evacuation of the Reagan Library has forced about 30,000 residents from their homes and injured three firefighters, authorities said Wednesday night.
Dearest Friends, The past week has been devastating for Sonoma County with the Kincade Wildfire threatening many homes, businesses, vineyards, and communities across the county.

The latest on the #KincadeFire: almost 77,000 acres burned, 45% contained, 266 structures destroyed. 76,000+ acres already scorched by the #Kincade fire that continues to burn in California.
